Brazil Trivia
The Brazil Trivia Game will test your knowledge in basic concepts of Brazil\'s geography, culture food and other aspects.\n\nHave fun!

Select the answer from the options given. Each time you get an answer correct or wrong, you can advance to the next question.\n\n Points are increased by each right answer submitted. You can return to the title screen using up or back from within the game screen, and this will also end your game.

Rio is the capital of Brazil.
Amazon is the most popular Brazilian river.
Brazilian carnival usually starts in February.
Volleyball is Brazil\'s most popular sport.
Brazil has already won 13 Volleyball World Cups.
The famous Copacabana and Ipanema beaches are located in Rio.
The official language of Brazil is Spanish.
Sao Paulo is the largest city in Brazil.
Brazil has the second largest country area of the world.
The city of Ouro Preto is located in Sao Paulo.
Brazil has more than 30 states within its area.
Green, yellow and blue. The colors in the Brazilian flag represent the forests, gold and the sky/rivers, respectively.
Pele is a famous basketball player.
Itaipu is one of the largest dams in the world.
Brazil borders all other South American countries.
Brazil is located in Central America.
Brazil population is estimated at 212,559,417 people.
The Pacific ocean borders Brazil to the East.
The money or currency of Brazil is called Peso.
Brazil is ruled by a president.
